image.altText: A police security office in a navy uniform walks down a road to a large school building

props.synopsis: The South Australian premier says an investigation into an 18-year-old man's alleged threats of a "physical attack" at public events and to an Adelaide school was "the most complex" case he has been briefed on.

title.children: Teen called himself 'prophet of justice' in alleged school threats

image.altText: a man in a blue formal shirt sitting at a park bench with a body of water behind him

props.synopsis: Riverland resident Mike Fuller is pleased to see government agencies have admitted some faults, particularly in sourcing local knowledge, when managing major River Murray flooding.

title.children: Flooded residents welcome call to be included should another disaster strike

image.altText: A photo of a young couple smiling at the camera while sitting in the backseat of a car

props.synopsis: Former Olympian cyclist Melissa Hoskins died after being struck by a car driven by her husband outside their Adelaide home. This is how the case against Rohan Dennis unfolded.

title.children: How an argument ended with the 'unfair and tragic' death of a champion cyclist

image.altText: An alleged dangerous driver outside the Christies Beach Magistrates Court.

props.synopsis: A driver who rammed a motorcyclist into a pole during a road rage incident in Adelaide's south, leaving her with life-threatening injuries, has been jailed.

title.children: Road rage driver jailed after leaving woman 'lucky to be alive'

image.altText: Luke holds a platter of edible insects next to wine glasses.

props.synopsis: From pet food to human food, insects have many potential uses in Australia. But the industry has to overcome some big challenges around public perception first.

title.children: Insects with your wine? Vineyard's bid to capitalise on growing trend

image.altText: Tom Koutsantonis talking in front of leafy a backdrop

props.synopsis: A ban on preferential bookings in a bid to ensure a fairer and more reliable access taxi system will come into effect next week.

title.children: Changes to 'broken' access cab system amid 'corruption' claims

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: South Australia's work safety agency is examining the circumstances surrounding the collapse of a stone wall that claimed the life of a 46-year-old man on a property in the Barossa region.

title.children: Man killed in stone wall collapse in Barossa Valley

image.altText: A red and white sign reads '2022/23 flood level' with an arrow pointing down to a red line, a dirt levee is behind it

props.synopsis: A damning report reviewing one of South Australia's worst natural disasters in the state's history reflects on how some government agencies could have improved their response.

title.children: SA government agencies 'fell short' in flood response, report finds

image.altText: A group of emergency services personnel stand facing the back of an ambulance with a large white sheet to the left

props.synopsis: The man has been taken to hospital and is in a critical but stable condition.

title.children: Man bitten by shark off SA beach, emergency services say

image.altText: A mechanic with a car.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's election pledge for nuclear reactors caused deep divisions within the community of Port Augusta — now that it's been taken off the agenda, locals are looking towards different futures.

title.children: Nuclear off the table in Port Augusta, as locals look in other directions

image.altText: Repair works on electrical infrastructure.

props.synopsis: Business owners are urged to review their policies after a blackout that took 26,000 properties offline in March. Just one of 70 surveyed traders says their insurance has covered the losses.

title.children: What happens to a small town when the power goes out for 24 hours

image.altText: A young woman holding a drill and sitting on a round table and a middle-aged man standing behind her holding a hammer in a room

props.synopsis: A social media star who purchased her first home during a road trip to outback NSW says renovating it and two other properties with her dad helps her unwind from her busy life.

title.children: TikTok star's outback reno side hustle boosts father-daughter bond

image.altText: A truck carrying a wind turbine stuck under a bridge

props.synopsis: A major Queensland highway could remain closed for days after a truck carrying half of a wind turbine collided with a bridge.

title.children: Truck carrying wind turbine collides with bridge closing major Qld highway

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old man has been arrested over a hit-and-run that claimed the life of a 20-year-old woman in Adelaide's north-east last week.

title.children: Man charged over fatal hit-and-run in Adelaide's north-east

image.altText: a document in a case

props.synopsis: A "copy" of the Magna Carta purchased by Harvard in the 40s has been confirmed as a rare original from 1300.

title.children: Harvard discovers it bought one of the world's 'most important documents' in 1946

image.altText: A selfie of a man on a street

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old refugee who sexually assaulted two women and a teenage girl was told by a judge "even in Iraq, you shouldn't be harassing women like this".

title.children: DoorDash driver 'so sorry' for 'predatory' sexual assaults

image.altText: Four bearded men point weapons in the air

props.synopsis: Russia and Afghanistan have centuries-old links, but the Kremlin's recent activity in statements about the Taliban are underscored by an evolved security and geo-political landscape of the last three years.

title.children: Russia's growing support of the Taliban may be part of Putin's 'political signalling'

props.synopsis: The ABC went on a multi-country investigation in the Pacific to understand one of the world's worst gender violence crises. What we found was much more complicated than a story about victimhood.

title.children: When home becomes hell: Inside one of the world's worst gender violence crises

image.altText: Sussan Ley, David Littleproud, Angus Taylor, Peter Dutton QT 20221027_041653670_iOS

props.synopsis: David Littleproud and Sussan Ley have had a previously combustible relationship but will have to find a path forward.

title.children: The Coalition must figure out its answer to the net zero question

image.altText: A boy leans over a book and draws with a texter.

props.synopsis: Oliver arrived at Elaine's on the eve of his 7th birthday, with a black bin bag in tow. With no training to be a foster carer, she quit after three weeks.

title.children: 'I'm set up to fail': Foster carer quits after three weeks of caring for young boy

image.altText: A woman holds a sign saying "protect birthright citizenship" in front of the US supreme court

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's fight to end automatic citizenship for people born on US soil has reached the Supreme Court, with justices grappling with whether to maintain a freeze on his attempt.

title.children: What does birthright citizenship mean? Can Trump abolish it?

image.altText: Tommy Paul reacts at Madrid Open.

props.synopsis: Tommy Paul puts off-court distractions in his rear-view mirror at the Italian Open this week after the American's beloved truck is repossessed at his home in Florida.

title.children: 'Missed a couple payments': US tennis star's truck gets repossessed

image.altText: Anthony Albanese seated at diplomatic event, feeding a cat in a pram.

props.synopsis: Just before Anthony Albanese left Indonesia, he had a cute encounter with President Prabowo Subianto's cat. The prime minister gifted Bobby Kertanegara a scarf that reads "Australia loves Indonesia".

title.children: Anthony Albanese gifts Indonesian president's cat a scarf

image.altText: A ewe with docked tail, and lamb stand in a dry, dusty paddock.

props.synopsis: Hay prices jumped dramatically in some parts of Australia this week with a supplier saying he had sold more this week than in any of the big droughts in the past 20 years.

title.children: Desperate farmers scramble for hay as drought bites

image.altText: An excavator ploughs through rubbish at a tip.

props.synopsis: The NSW government has announced a plan to address a coming landfill crisis, but industry figures say it is only the first step.

title.children: Bin collection in jeopardy as NSW waste crisis looms, minister says

image.altText: Solar panels line up under a bright blue sky.

props.synopsis: The project is big enough to power a quarter of the homes in the NSW Northern Rivers, and it could be the first of three for the rural area where it will be based.

title.children: Solar farm able to power 36,000 homes approved by NSW government

image.altText: People letting off fireworks on a beach

props.synopsis: More than 100 tonnes of fireworks bound for the NT's Territory Day celebrations have been seized by NSW authorities, prompting the NT chief minister to appeal to the NSW premier.

title.children: More than 100 tonnes of Territory Day fireworks seized by NSW authorities

image.altText: A satellite image shows the tops of buildings from above.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says a video it released that claimed to show Hamas-built tunnels underneath a southern Gaza hospital actually show different buildings.

title.children: Israel concedes error in video claiming to show Hamas tunnels under hospital

image.altText: Tom Cruise hanging onto the wing of an airborne biplane.

props.synopsis: With the final film in the Mission: Impossible franchise here, we take a look at how Tom Cruise turned himself into this generation's great action hero.

title.children: He's 62 and does his own stunts. Is Tom Cruise the last great action hero?

image.altText: Luke Beveridge scratches his head

props.synopsis: Western Bulldogs coach Luke Beveridge warns Port Adelaide chair David Koch of retribution over a claim Willie Rioli was sledged by his players.

title.children: Beveridge fires back at claims Bulldogs provoked Power's Rioli

image.altText: A series of houses in Sydney with numerous dollar signs edited into the picture next to the houses.

props.synopsis: Research from Cotality shows the portion of dwellings valued at $1 million or more has risen from just below 10 per cent in April 2015, to more than 34 per cent a decade later.

title.children: Why $1 million is far from an all-access pass to the housing market

image.altText: Man speaks and points in parliament

props.synopsis: The NT Labor opposition claims the government pushed new sacred sites laws through parliament to help a hotel proposal at the Darwin Waterfront proceed.

title.children: Changes to NT sacred sites law pass parliament, to opposition criticism

image.altText: A man's side profile in shadows with a phone close to his face

props.synopsis: Online gambling provider PointsBet Australia has been fined for sending spam messages and marketing material to people who had registered to be excluded. Some experts have called on the federal government to set up a national gambling regulator.

title.children: PointsBet fined $500,000 after spamming customers with gambling ads

image.altText: A woman in a red dress with red painted nails toasting a man with champagne.

props.synopsis: In the 'sugar dating' world, attractive young women date rich older men to facilitate the kind of romance you pay for. But things can go wrong when sex mixes with money, wealth and power.

title.children: What life is like as a sugar baby who dates older men
